TopicTitle: The Official Kerbin Cup Tournament Thread - Final Entries Posted

Articles.Content:
As we speak, millions of people all over the earth have come together to celebrate national pride through sport, as the finest footballers from 32 countries represent them in the World Cup. We at Squad want you to not only take pride in being part of the KSP community, but also in your own slice of the community - your Ã¢â‚¬Å“nation,Ã¢â‚¬Â if you will. With that, we proudly present the first ever Kerbin Cup tournament! This thread will only be used to discuss the tournament.

The Kerbin Cup tournament will consist of four teams of four people who will represent the best of what the following two community channels have to offer - Reddit and The Forum. Each team will collaborate on a mystery challenge that will be revealed each Monday. Team submissions must be handed in by that Friday. When they have, they will be posted here, sans team names, ready for a community vote that will take place over the course of the weekend. The team on each side that gathers the lowest number of votes will be eliminated from the competition.This will continue until there are just two teams left, all culminating in a grand finale that will be judged by members of Squad.

Now after all this, you might be wondering what youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re playing for. Well, much like weekÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s challenge, the grand prize itself will remain a mystery until the time is right. However, you will also get the added bonus of being able to exclusively use the image of the Golden Kerbal as the avatar or flair on your community channel of choice.

Here are several other official rules you must abide by:

1. No one outside of your team is eligible to contribute to your project without direct permission from me. Permission will only be granted in the event of certain circumstances, such as technical problems, acts of nature, etc. Those caught using contributions from non-team members without direct permission will be disqualified from competition.

2. Deadlines for entry are from the time each challenge is announced to Friday at 6PM, Central Daylight Time.

3. There is only one submission per team. Make it count.

4. You must not talk about your work or reveal your work to the community until we unveil it and make it open for votes.

5. Voting will close at the time a new challenge is posted and eliminations have been announced.

Challenge 1 Results

The Forum:

Team Jedi - Team 2

Crotchety Old Modders - Team 1

I Think We Broke It - Team 4

The A-Team - Team 3 (Eliminated)

Reddit:

Kerb-O-Nautix - Team 2

Shock Diamond - Team 4

Team clown_baby - Team 1

Team Snacks - Team 3 (Eliminated)

Challenge 2 Results

The Forum:

Crotchety Old Modders - Team 3

I Think We Broke It - Team 2

Team Jedi - Team 1

Reddit:

Kerb-O-Nautix - Team 4

Shock Diamond - Team 6

Team clown_baby - Team 5

Challenge 3 Results

The Forum:

Your Forum champion is Crotchety Old Modders!

I Think We Broke It

Team Jedi

Reddit

Shock Diamond and Team Clown_Baby have both bowed out of the competition.

Your Reddit champion is Kerb-O-Nautix!

Final Challenge

The final challenge is here! It's Crotchety Old Modders vs. Kerb-O-Nautix in a duel to the figurative death. More like a gentlemanly duel, actually, since the challenge is in their hands. Here's a brief explanation of what each team has to do. Both teams will have a week to complete their respective challenges, starting on July 24 at 9 AM CDT and ending on July 31 at 9AM CDT.

CROTCHETY OLD MODDERS

They must build a Mars colony that can survive for a year and produce an imgur album of at least ten photos of their mission. They must use actual and proposed NASA hardware from the 1970's from the Integrated Program Plan, along with the aid of realism mods. Excluded mods include those that decrease the level of realism and cheat physics. Hyperedit will definitely not be in play. Any other mods may be used within reason.

KERB-O-NAUTIX

They must travel through the universe, visiting as many places as they can, making sure that three Kerbals return safely back to Kerbin. All this, while making sure to produce an imgur album of at least ten photos from the mission. The team must use TAC Lifesupport, FAR, and only 100 tons of LV total. They must take three kerbals, a three-person command pod and a hitchiker. Not allowed? Crazy propulsion mods, no ions, no jets that aren't AJE and no mods that allow you to do things you cannot do in real life. They will not be able to use seats, either, with the exception of landers and rovers.

It's kitschy, it's cool and it's 100% Kerbal. This is a render for an exclusive, Shapeways 3D print made just for the winners of the Kerbin Cup. It encapsulates the spirit of the contest and the company's Mexican futbol heritage, by presenting a Kerbal inspired by the breakthrough keeper for the Mexican National Team, Guillermo Ochoa.

Active Forum Team

Crotchety Old Modders:

ferram4

Majiir

NathanKell

r4m0n

Edited August 4, 2014 by Rainbowtrout
